intro: Scyphogyne micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered scyphogyne, is a member of the family Rhamnaceae. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, which are often borne on the ends of the branches. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain several seeds. Scyphogyne micrantha is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded habitats.
